archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Gochujang–Chorizo Fried Rice with Grilled Corn and Quick-Pickled Cabbage
description: Spicy gochujang fried rice studded with crispy chorizo and fire-kissed corn, served with a bright, crunchy cabbage pickle and avocado-lime finish. A bold Korean–Latin mashup built from scratch.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain well.
Shuck 2 ears corn (or measure 1 1/2 cups kernels).
Dice 1 avocado; cut 1 lime into wedges and reserve half for juice.
In a bowl, mix 3 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, and 1/2 tsp salt for the quick pickle.
In a small cup, stir together 2 tbsp gochujang, 1 tsp chilli flakes, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, and 1/4 tsp black pepper.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Combine rinsed jasmine rice and water in a pot; bring to a simmer, cover, and cook on low 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 10 minutes; spread on a tray to steam off.
Quick-pickle cabbage: Toss sliced cabbage with the vinegar-sugar-salt mix and a squeeze of lime. Massage 30 seconds and set aside, tossing occasionally.
Grill corn: Preheat OutdoorGrill to high. Grill corn 6–8 minutes, turning, until lightly charred. Cut kernels off cobs. (StoveTop alternative: char kernels in a dry skillet on high 3–4 minutes.)
Crisp chorizo: Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high. Add diced chorizo; cook 3–4 minutes until browned and rendered. Scoop out, leaving fat in pan.
Stir-fry aromatics: Add onion and bell peppers; stir-fry 3 minutes. Add garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Fry rice: Add 1 tbsp canola oil and the cooled rice. Stir-fry 3–4 minutes, breaking clumps until hot and a bit toasted.

Season: Push rice to the sides; add the gochujang mixture to the center. Sizzle 30 seconds, then toss to coat evenly. Add grilled corn and cooked chorizo; stir. Drizzle 1 tsp sesame oil and adjust salt to taste.

Finish and serve: Fold in half the chopped coriander and a squeeze of lime. Plate fried rice, top with diced avocado, remaining coriander, and extra chilli flakes or habanero sauce to taste. Serve with quick-pickled cabbage on the side and lime wedges.

ingredients.quantity: 4 tbsp total (3 tbsp for pickle, 1 tbsp for sauce)
2 tbsp total (1 tbsp for chorizo, 1 tbsp for rice)

final_ingredients.quantity: 4 tbsp total (3 tbsp for pickle, 1 tbsp for sauce)
2 tbsp total (1 tbsp for chorizo, 1 tbsp for rice)
